Sweet and Spicy Air Fryer Bacon

Jump to Recipe

Looking for a deliciously unique way to prepare bacon? Look no further than this Sweet and Spicy Air Fryer Bacon recipe! Perfect for breakfast, brunch, or as a savory snack, this dish combines the mouthwatering crunch of crispy bacon with a delightful blend of sweetness and heat. With just a handful of simple ingredients like brown sugar, chili powder, and a hint of maple syrup, you can elevate your bacon game like never before. Plus, cooking bacon in the air fryer ensures that it cooks evenly and achieves that perfect crispy texture, all while minimizing the mess and grease typically associated with traditional frying methods. Whether you’re serving it alongside eggs, adding it to a salad, or enjoying it on its own, this recipe is sure to impress. Get ready to indulge in a sweet and spicy flavor explosion that will have your taste buds dancing!

Ingredients

bacon strips

Choose thick-cut bacon for a meatier texture and better resistance to shriveling during cooking. If you prefer a healthier option, you can substitute with turkey bacon, though it may not crisp up as much. Ensure the strips are laid out in a single layer in the air fryer for even cooking.

brown sugar

Brown sugar adds a rich, caramel flavor to the bacon. For a healthier alternative, you can use coconut sugar or a sugar substitute like stevia; however, keep in mind that the texture and caramelization may vary. If you want a deeper flavor, try using dark brown sugar instead of light.

chili powder

Chili powder adds a mild heat and depth of flavor. You can substitute with smoked paprika for a smokier taste, or cayenne pepper if you prefer more heat. For a more complex flavor, consider using a mix of spices like cumin and garlic powder.

black pepper

Freshly ground black pepper will provide a stronger flavor compared to pre-ground. For a different twist, try using white pepper for a milder taste or a blend of peppers for added complexity. Adjust the amount based on your heat tolerance.

red pepper flakes

Red pepper flakes provide an extra kick. If you want to tone down the heat, use crushed black pepper or omit them altogether. Alternatively, you could substitute with a dash of hot sauce or sriracha for a different flavor profile.

maple syrup (optional)

Maple syrup enhances sweetness and adds a unique flavor. If you don’t have maple syrup, you can use honey or agave syrup as a substitute. For a sugar-free option, try sugar-free maple syrup or a drizzle of balsamic glaze for a tangy sweetness.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Preheat the Air Fryer

    Set your air fryer to 400°F (200°C). This step is crucial as preheating ensures that your bacon cooks evenly and crisps up nicely.

  • Step 2: Prepare the Spice Mixture

    In a small bowl, combine 2 tablespoons of brown sugar, 1 teaspoon of chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon of black pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon of red pepper flakes. Mix well until all ingredients are evenly incorporated.

  • Step 3: Arrange the Bacon Strips

    Lay 8 slices of bacon in the air fryer basket in a single layer. Avoid overlapping the strips to ensure they cook evenly and become crispy.

  • Step 4: Season the Bacon

    Sprinkle the brown sugar and spice mixture evenly over the bacon strips, ensuring each piece is well-coated. For an extra touch of sweetness, drizzle 1 tablespoon of maple syrup over the bacon if desired.

  • Step 5: Cook the Bacon

    Cook the bacon in the air fryer for 10-15 minutes. Check halfway through the cooking time and flip the bacon strips for even cooking. Adjust the cooking time based on how crispy you like your bacon.

  • Step 6: Drain Excess Grease

    Once cooked to your liking, remove the bacon from the air fryer and place it on a plate lined with paper towels. This will help absorb any excess grease, keeping your bacon crispy.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I prepare bacon strips for cooking?

Simply take the bacon out of the packaging and lay the strips flat. If they are stuck together, gently separate them without tearing.

What is the best way to measure brown sugar?

Brown sugar is best packed into the measuring spoon or cup. Use the back of a spoon to press it down firmly, ensuring you get an accurate measure.

Can I adjust the spice level in the recipe?

Absolutely! If you prefer it spicier, you can add more chili powder or red pepper flakes. For less heat, reduce the amounts.

How do I know when the bacon is done cooking?

The bacon is done when it's crispy and has reached your desired level of doneness. Remember, it will continue to crisp a bit after you remove it from the air fryer.

What should I do if my air fryer is smoking?

If you notice smoke, it could be due to excess grease. Clean the basket and ensure there are no leftover particles from previous cooking. Consider lowering the temperature slightly.

Is it safe to handle hot bacon?

Always use tongs to remove hot bacon from the air fryer to avoid burns. Let it cool on paper towels, which will absorb excess grease.

What can I do with leftover bacon grease?

You can save the bacon grease for cooking! Let it cool, then strain it into a jar and store it in the fridge. Use it for frying vegetables or adding flavor to dishes.

Can I use a different sweetener instead of brown sugar?

Yes! You can substitute with honey, agave syrup, or coconut sugar, but be aware the flavor and texture may vary slightly.

What can I serve with sweet and spicy bacon?

This bacon pairs well with pancakes, waffles, or as a topping for salads and burgers. Get creative!

How do I clean my air fryer after cooking?

Allow it to cool, then wipe down the basket and tray with warm, soapy water. Most air fryer parts are dishwasher-safe, but check your manual to be sure.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

This dish is not suitable for vegetarians or vegans due to the use of bacon. To cater to dietary preferences, consider using turkey bacon or a plant-based alternative to maintain a similar flavor profile while reducing fat content. Additionally, the recipe is gluten-free as all the ingredients are naturally gluten-free. For a lower sugar option, reduce the amount of brown sugar or skip the maple syrup altogether.

Pairings

Serve sweet and spicy air fryer bacon with fluffy scrambled eggs or a savory omelet for a delicious breakfast. Pair it with crispy toast or warm pancakes to balance the flavors. For beverages, consider serving it with fresh-squeezed orange juice or a spicy Bloody Mary to enhance the breakfast experience. For lunch or dinner, it pairs wonderfully with a side salad, roasted vegetables, or even as a topping for burgers and sandwiches.

Serving Suggestions

For an appealing presentation, arrange the cooked bacon on a serving platter and garnish with fresh herbs like parsley or chives. Serve warm, allowing guests to enjoy the aroma. Consider drizzling additional maple syrup on the side for dipping or extra sweetness. This dish can also be served as an appetizer at parties, cut into smaller pieces and served with toothpicks. For a fun twist, create a bacon bar with toppings like crumbled blue cheese, jalapeños, and avocado, allowing guests to customize their bites.
